ArticleTitle.sentence: Transcriptional activity and constitutive nuclear localization of the ETS protein Elf-1.

event.clue: Transcriptional activity and constitutive nuclear localization of the ETS protein Elf-1.
Transcriptional activity and constitutive nuclear localization of the ETS protein Elf-1.

AbstractText.sentence: Elf-1 is a lymphoid-specific transcription factor that belongs to the ETS protein family.
It can bind to DNA target sequences within a variety of cytokine genes.

event.clue: It can bind to DNA target sequences within a variety of cytokine genes.

AbstractText.sentence: We demonstrate that Elf-1 is constitutively localized in the nucleus which is dependent on the presence of amino acids 86-265.

event.clue: We demonstrate that Elf-1 is constitutively localized in the nucleus which is dependent on the presence of amino acids 86-265.
We demonstrate that Elf-1 is constitutively localized in the nucleus which is dependent on the presence of amino acids 86-265.

AbstractText.sentence: Analysis of Gal4-Elf-1 fusion proteins revealed that the N-terminal 86 amino acids of Elf-1 contain a transcriptional activation domain, the activity of which is attenuated by an internal repression domain.

event.clue: Analysis of Gal4-Elf-1 fusion proteins revealed that the N-terminal 86 amino acids of Elf-1 contain a transcriptional activation domain, the activity of which is attenuated by an internal repression domain.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, Elf-1 interacts specifically with the E74 target sequence and can stimulate transcription driven by the E74 site independent of mitogenic signaling.

event.clue: Furthermore, Elf-1 interacts specifically with the E74 target sequence and can stimulate transcription driven by the E74 site independent of mitogenic signaling.
Furthermore, Elf-1 interacts specifically with the E74 target sequence and can stimulate transcription driven by the E74 site independent of mitogenic signaling.

AbstractText.sentence: Thus, Elf-1 is able to stimulate gene transcription which may be required for the development and activity of lymphocytes.

event.clue: Thus, Elf-1 is able to stimulate gene transcription which may be required for the development and activity of lymphocytes.
